text: tap @ czech beerfest (budapest) amber colour, normal body, average carbonated, bitter, malty, hoppy, fruity, easy to drink

Appearance: Orange light brown, slight haze. Slight off-white head.
Aroma: Slight butterscotch, light malt and sweetness.
Taste: Light malt, butterscotch, light bitterness. Slight sweetness.
Bought: Trade with Cuso - thanks!, 750 ml
Info: 29/4-2017, BB: ??/??-????

Draught @ U Sumavy, Prague. Pours dark golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, grain, hay. Flavor is light sweet, malty, grain, light caramel, hay. Medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. 150417

75cl bottle from a trade with Cuso, many thanks! Pours almost clear orange golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of light reddish malt, hazelnuts. Taste of hazelnuts, mild spicy hops, reddish malt, caramel, hazelnuts in the aftertaste, nice!

Bottle, 75 cl. Pours a clear amber beer with a big, overcarbonated white head on top. Aroma of caramel and nutty notes, some lager notes. Flavor is mildly sweet and malty, light bitter in the aftertaste. Carbonation is very high, aftertaste is medium long and light sweet. Decent.

Tap at Zastavka, Brno. Poured a deep amber brown with a lasting off white head. Aroma of caramel, dark fruit, malt and hop. Medium sweetness and light bitterness. Medium body and sticky texture. Good beer.

0,75l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop Bratislava, BBD: 01/03/16 Pours clear light amber liquid, big frothy white head, fell down quickly, Aroma: malty, caramel, Taste: light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light sour, caramel, malty, hopy, light herbal, Palate: medium body, soft to average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long malty caramel aftertaste, Overall: fine, easy drinkable, enjoyable czech amber lager. Could imagine a better one, but nothing to reproach.

On tap, zastavka. Clear amber body with high white head. Aroma has some DMS, malty, light caramel. Taste has high malty sweetness, little bit nutty, medium to low short lasting bitterness. Body is dry, medium carbonation.

On tap at "na 7.schode", Zilina. Golden to light amber clear with big persistent white head, fair lacing. Herbal, caramel, buttery in aroma. Taste is moderate bitter, light sweet, caramel, toasty. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Fresh and very drinkable.
Nice amber color. Soft carbonation. Oxidized smell. Light body with nutty notes, watery mouthfeel. Fast finish with a medium bitterness. Bitterness lasts a bit.

(tap 0,5l @ Zastávka (Brno))
Aroma: Malty, nuts, toasty.
Appearance: Clear amber color. Minimal, white head.
Taste: Malty, nuts, vienna malt, medium sweet, light bitter.
Palate: Medium body. Dry finish.
Overall: Nice malty vienna-like.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Na čape v Local Pube. Jantárová farba, stredná rezkosť, sluná horkost, pivo krásne krúkuje. Vysoko piteľné pivo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fľaa. Jantárová farba, biela pena. Vôňa sladová, jemne karamelová. V chuti najskôr sladká sladovosť, potom karamel a med. Pitné pivko.
Bottle. Aroma malty, caramel, honeyish, soft. Clear amber colour. Taste is nicely balanced, mostly malty, caramel, honey, moderate bitterness, noble Saaz flavour. Very good.

(Draught at Zly Casy, Prague, 18 July 2014) Pale amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, spicy nose with notes of crisp-bread, orange peel and spicy hops. Malty taste with toast, crisp-bread, orange peel and a gentle spicy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Tasty and well balanced. Quite nice.
UPDATED: JUN 29, 2014 Bottle kindly shared by MisoW. Amber colored with medium white head. Caramel, red fruits in aroma. Caramel, red fruits, bee wax, little bit harsh bitterness in finish.
Bottle. Pours amber color, white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, bit sugary. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, lightly hoppy bitter.

Bottled. Appears darkish amber colored body with a shameful but pretty white foam. Aroma is based on caramel tones with some malts, fruits and spices. Rich medium body, bordered by caramel tones, hoppy flovered finish, not so long, but it is expected for such kind of beer. Very-very nice in overall, totally drinkable one.
on tap at the 2013 festival minipivovaru at prague castle. light brown with a frothy head; a bit messy and sludgy; some frothy apple, carramel, grassy compost heap, modest bitterness
Really nice aroma, thin fading head and fine bitterness. But overall taste isnt as smooth as it could be. Ambigous aftertaste.

From bottle at bottleshop in Prague. Dark gold-amber pour with thin white head. Grainy aroma, light fruitiness, light banana, caramel and spice. Taste of light toasted grain, hoppy finish. Well executed but a bit dull.

My Bottom Line:
Spicy hops and lightly toasted malts coalesce in this prickly Vienna-like brew.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the misty amber.
-This tastes like a cross between a Vienna (not Polotmavé) and Svetly.
-The flavor profile is balanced.
-The mouthfeel is lean and highly drinkable.

Fresh PET bottle.
